title: A Cultural Revolution | Guests: Rep. Stewart & Jason Whitlock | 10/12/21
description:
Sam Crutchfield, former local president in the California Teachers' Association, joins to discuss what’s going on in California schools and why he can no longer be a part of it. Rep. Chris Stewart joins to discuss the letter he wrote to AG Merrick Garland regarding the FBI investigating parents who are standing up against school boards. Victor Davis Hanson, the author of “The Dying Citizen,” joins to discuss the ongoing cultural revolution in America. Glenn and Stu discuss an Afghan interpreter being left behind and how the Nazarene Fund played a role in his rescue. BlazeTV host Jason Whitlock joins Glenn to discuss a coach being forced to resign because of old emails and the idea of cancel culture.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

Sam Crutchfield, former local president in the California Teachers' Association, joins to discuss what’s going on in California schools and why he can no longer be a part of it. Rep. Chris Stewart joins to discuss the letter he wrote to AG Merrick Garland regarding the FBI investigating parents who are standing up against school boards. Victor Davis Hanson, the author of “The Dying Citizen,” joins to discuss the ongoing cultural revolution in America. Glenn and Stu discuss an Afghan interpreter being left behind and how the Nazarene Fund played a role in his rescue. BlazeTV host Jason Whitlock joins Glenn to discuss a coach being forced to resign because of old emails and the idea of cancel culture.
